results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = 2*n-4*k+5 (n >= 0, 1 <= k <= 1+floor(n/2)).
comment: All terms are odd, decreasing across rows. Row sums = A000217, the triangular numbers.
Triangle read by rows formed from the antidiagonals of triangle A099375.
The alternating row sums equal A098181(n). (End)
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Rows n = 0..200 of irregular triangle, flattened
formula: By columns, odd terms in every column, n-th column starts at row (2*n).
example: First few rows of the triangle =
maple: T := proc(n,k) return 2*n-4*k+5: end: seq(seq(T(n,k), k=1..1+floor(n/2)), n=0..20); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, May 01 2011
